how would you describe your main use cas: Note-taking;Task and project management (including CRMs);As a knowledge base (including technical, non-fiction and encyclopaedic content)
do you share your tiddlywiki(s) with oth: No, but I may export content into other formats and share individual tiddlers, the whole wiki, or an extract of the wiki
putting it all together, what value does:
TiddlyWiki is what I keep coming back to for personal knowledge management (at work). Its hierarchical tagging gives me more flexibility than other tagging systems I have come across.

It is only the lack of easy mobile editing/saving that means I don't use it more
what is your level of ability with tiddl: I have customised TiddlyWiki through options and plugins;I am comfortable using WikiText widgets (e.g. <$transclude>, <$list>...);I am comfortable writing filter expressions;I have written custom HTML;I have written custom CSS styles
how do you save changes in tiddlywiki?: Single-file wiki through web browser with Download Saver (default saving mechanism);Single-file wiki with custom saver (e.g. TiddlyPWA, Timimi, tw5-browser-nativesaver)
how do you back up/sync changes between: Consumer online storage (e.g. Google Drive, Dropbox)
what are we doing well? prompts for thin: The longevity and community help means I am confident in its future. I am interested to see what saving mechanisms and the use of MWS might allow collaborative use in organisations.
what could we do better? prompts for thi:
Obsidian is tempting due to the sheer size of the community, and therefore, plugins.

Unfortunately, unless retirement ever comes along, I would find it difficult to contribute the time to help out more.
with your consent, we would like to publ: Yes, I am happy for my responses to be published
